event.descr:
The appliance is in process of rebooting. The name of the user who issued the command is contained in trapObjectUserName.

trapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;
event.logmsg: rebootStartedTrap trap received trapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]%

event.descr:
This trap is sent when user logged into appliance. The name of the user who logged in is contained in trapObjectUserName and the method used to log into appliance is contained in trapObjectSessionType.

trapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

trapObjectSessionType %parm[#2]%;

ssh(1) telnet(2) webui(3) spshell(4)
event.logmsg: userLoginTrap trap received trapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]% trapObjectSessionType=%parm[#2]%

event.descr:
A user logged out from OnBoard The name of the user who logged out is contained in trapObjectUserName. and the method used to log into appliance is contained in trapObjectSessionType.

trapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

trapObjectSessionType %parm[#2]%;

ssh(1) telnet(2) webui(3) spshell(4)
event.logmsg: userLogoutTrap trap received trapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]% trapObjectSessionType=%parm[#2]%

event.descr:
User login fail to the OnBoard. trapObjectUserName: The name of the user who failed to log into appliance.

trapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;
event.logmsg: loginFailed trap received trapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]%

event.descr:
The appliance detected a device alert. trapObjectDeviceName: contains the device name trapObjectDeviceNumber: contains the dive unique id number trapObjectAlertIndex: contains the index of the alert trapObjectAlertString: contains the name of the alert trapObjectAlertMessage: contains the alert message.

trapObjectDeviceName %parm[#1]%;

trapObjectDeviceNumber %parm[#2]%;

trapObjectAlertIndex %parm[#3]%;

trapObjectAlertString %parm[#4]%;

trapObjectAlertMessage %parm[#5]%;
event.logmsg: portAlertTrap trap received trapObjectDeviceName=%parm[#1]% trapObjectDeviceNumber=%parm[#2]% trapObjectAlertIndex=%parm[#3]% trapObjectAlertString=%parm[#4]% trapObjectAlertMessage=%parm[#5]%

event.descr:
This trap is generated when daemons on the OnBoard is started. trapObjectUserName is name of the User who started the daemon. trapObjectDaemonName is name of the daemon.

trapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

trapObjectDaemonName %parm[#2]%;
event.logmsg: daemonStarted trap received trapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]% trapObjectDaemonName=%parm[#2]%

event.descr:
This trap is generated when Network daemons in OnBoard stopped. trapObjectUserName is name of the User who stopped the daemon. trapObjectDaemonName is name of the daemon.

trapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

trapObjectDaemonName %parm[#2]%;
event.logmsg: daemonStopped trap received trapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]% trapObjectDaemonName=%parm[#2]%

event.descr:
This trap is generated when previous session terminated by new Admin user. trapObjectUserName contains the NEW admin user name. trapObjectTargetUserName contains name of the user whose session was terminated.

trapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

trapObjectTargetUserName %parm[#2]%;
event.logmsg: adminSessionTerminatedTrap trap received trapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]% trapObjectTargetUserName=%parm[#2]%

event.descr:
This trap is generated when 'saveconf' is successful. trapObjectUserName is name of the user who executed saveconf.

trapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;
event.logmsg: configurationSavedTrap trap received trapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]%

event.descr:
This trap is generated when new configuration is activated. trapObjectUserName is name of the user who activated new configuration.

trapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;
event.logmsg: configurationActivatedTrap trap received trapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]%

event.descr:
This trap is generated when user is added to OnBoard. trapObjectUserName is name of user who added new user. trapObjectTargetUserName is name of the new user.

trapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

trapObjectTargetUserName %parm[#2]%;
event.logmsg: localUserAddedTrap trap received trapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]% trapObjectTargetUserName=%parm[#2]%

event.descr:
This trap is generated when user is deleted from OnBoard. trapObjectUserName is name of user who deleted other user. trapObjectTargetUserName is name of the user who was deleted.

trapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

trapObjectTargetUserName %parm[#2]%;
event.logmsg: localUserDeletedTrap trap received trapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]% trapObjectTargetUserName=%parm[#2]%

event.descr:
This trap is generated when OnBoard is managed by DSView and global data buffer has reached configured Low level Threshold. trapObjectDataBufferSize is current size of the buffer.

trapObjectDataBufferSize %parm[#1]%;
event.logmsg: dataBufferFullThresholdLowTrap trap received trapObjectDataBufferSize=%parm[#1]%

event.descr:
This trap is generated when OnBoard is managed by DSView and global data buffer has reached configured Med level Threshold. trapObjectDataBufferSize is current size of the buffer.

trapObjectDataBufferSize %parm[#1]%;
event.logmsg: dataBufferFullThresholdMedTrap trap received trapObjectDataBufferSize=%parm[#1]%

event.descr: This trap is generated when OnBoard is managed by DSView and global data buffer has exceeded beyond the size of buffer and data lost has occurred.
event.logmsg: dataBufferFullLostDataTrap trap received

event.descr: This trap is generated when OnBoard is managed by DSView and data lost occurred while collecting data from ssh, or telnet session to Appliance.
event.logmsg: applianceDataBufferLostTrap trap received

event.descr:
This trap is generated when PM is attached to aux port on OnBoard or PM is added to chain of IPDUs. trapObjectAuxPortName indicates the serial port name of PM. trapObjectAuxPortNumber indicates the serial port number. trapObjectCyPMCount indicates number of PM on the serial port. trapObjectCyPMSocketCount indicates total number of Sockets on serial port.

trapObjectAuxPortName %parm[#1]%;

trapObjectAuxPortNumber %parm[#2]%;

trapObjectPMCount %parm[#3]%;

trapObjectPMSocketCount %parm[#4]%;
event.logmsg: pmOnlineTrap trap received trapObjectAuxPortName=%parm[#1]% trapObjectAuxPortNumber=%parm[#2]% trapObjectPMCount=%parm[#3]% trapObjectPMSocketCount=%parm[#4]%

event.descr:
This trap is generated when PM is removed from serial port or communication error. trapObjectAuxPortName is serial port name of PM. trapObjectAuxPortNumber indicates the serial port number.

trapObjectAuxPortName %parm[#1]%;

trapObjectAuxPortNumber %parm[#2]%;
event.logmsg: pmOfflineTrap trap received trapObjectAuxPortName=%parm[#1]% trapObjectAuxPortNumber=%parm[#2]%

event.descr:
This trap is generated when outlet is turned on. trapObjectUserName is name of the user who turned this outlet on. trapObjectAuxPortNumber is the number of Aux port or IPDU. trapObjectPMSocketNumber is outlet number that was turned on. trapObjectPMSocketName is either outlet name in PM or associated Target Device Name.

trapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

trapObjectAuxPortNumber %parm[#2]%;

trapObjectPMSocketNumber %parm[#3]%;

trapObjectPMSocketName %parm[#4]%;
event.logmsg: pmSocketTurnedOnTrap trap received trapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]% trapObjectAuxPortNumber=%parm[#2]% trapObjectPMSocketNumber=%parm[#3]% trapObjectPMSocketName=%parm[#4]%

event.descr:
This trap is generated when outlet is turned off. trapObjectUserName is name of the user who turned this outlet off. trapObjectAuxPortNumber is the number of Aux port or IPDU. trapObjectPMSocketNumber is outlet number that was turned off. trapObjectPMSocketName is either outlet name in PM or associated Target Device Name.

trapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

trapObjectAuxPortNumber %parm[#2]%;

trapObjectPMSocketNumber %parm[#3]%;

trapObjectPMSocketName %parm[#4]%;
event.logmsg: pmSocketTurnedOffTrap trap received trapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]% trapObjectAuxPortNumber=%parm[#2]% trapObjectPMSocketNumber=%parm[#3]% trapObjectPMSocketName=%parm[#4]%

event.descr:
This trap is generated when outlet is cycled. trapObjectUserName is name of the user who cycled this outlet. trapObjectAuxPortNumber is the number of Aux port or IPDU. trapObjectPMSocketNumber is outlet number that was turned cycled. trapObjectPMSocketName is either outlet name in PM or associated Target Device Name.

trapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

trapObjectAuxPortNumber %parm[#2]%;

trapObjectPMSocketNumber %parm[#3]%;

trapObjectPMSocketName %parm[#4]%;
event.logmsg: pmSocketCycledTrap trap received trapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]% trapObjectAuxPortNumber=%parm[#2]% trapObjectPMSocketNumber=%parm[#3]% trapObjectPMSocketName=%parm[#4]%

event.descr:
This trap is generated when PM current reaches beyond or up to set threshold. trapObjectAuxPortName is name of the IPDU port. trapObjectAuxPortNumber is aux port number of IPDU port. trapObjectPMNumber is the IPDU # that exceeded the treshold. trapObjectCyPMCurrentValue is current value detected when this trap was originated.

trapObjectAuxPortName %parm[#1]%;

trapObjectAuxPortNumber %parm[#2]%;

trapObjectPMNumber %parm[#3]%;

trapObjectCyPMCurrentValue %parm[#4]%;
event.logmsg: pmMaxLoadThresholdReachedTrap trap received trapObjectAuxPortName=%parm[#1]% trapObjectAuxPortNumber=%parm[#2]% trapObjectPMNumber=%parm[#3]% trapObjectCyPMCurrentValue=%parm[#4]%

event.descr:
This trap is generated when PM current reaches back to below set threshold. trapObjectAuxPortName is name of the IPDU port. trapObjectAuxPortNumber is aux port number of IPDU port. trapObjectPMNumber is the IPDU # that exceeded the threshold. trapObjectCyPMCurrentValue is current value detected when this trap was originated.

trapObjectAuxPortName %parm[#1]%;

trapObjectAuxPortNumber %parm[#2]%;

trapObjectPMNumber %parm[#3]%;

trapObjectCyPMCurrentValue %parm[#4]%;
event.logmsg: pmMinLoadThresholdReachedTrap trap received trapObjectAuxPortName=%parm[#1]% trapObjectAuxPortNumber=%parm[#2]% trapObjectPMNumber=%parm[#3]% trapObjectCyPMCurrentValue=%parm[#4]%

event.descr:
An alert string was detected on a ssh or telnet session into the appliance. The name of user who was logged into the appliance when the alert string was detected is contained in trapObjectUserName. The index of the alert string that was detected in the message is contained in trapObjectAlertIndex. The alert string that was detected is contained in trapObjectAlertString. The line text where the alert string was detected is contained in trapObjectAlertMessage.

trapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

trapObjectAlertIndex %parm[#2]%;

trapObjectAlertString %parm[#3]%;

trapObjectAlertMessage %parm[#4]%;
event.logmsg: applianceAlertTrap trap received trapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]% trapObjectAlertIndex=%parm[#2]% trapObjectAlertString=%parm[#3]% trapObjectAlertMessage=%parm[#4]%

event.descr:
This trap is generated when user started the process to upgrade OnBoard. trapObjectUserName is name of the user who started firmware (FW) upgrade. trapFirmwareVersion is current FW version of OnBoard. trapNewFirmwareVersion is NEW FW version of OnBoard.

trapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

trapFirmwareVersion %parm[#2]%;

trapNewFirmwareVersion %parm[#3]%;
event.logmsg: firmwareUpgradeStarted trap received trapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]% trapFirmwareVersion=%parm[#2]% trapNewFirmwareVersion=%parm[#3]%

event.descr:
This trap is generated when Firmware upgraded is done to indicate the result. trapFirmwareUpdateResult is result of FW upgrade 1 indicate successful other indicates error message. trapNewFirmwareVersion is NEW FW version of OnBoard.

trapFirmwareUpdateResult %parm[#1]%;

imageUpgradeSuccess(1) imageUpgradeInternalError(2)

trapNewFirmwareVersion %parm[#2]%;
event.logmsg: firmwareUpgradeResultsTrap trap received trapFirmwareUpdateResult=%parm[#1]% trapNewFirmwareVersion=%parm[#2]%

event.descr:
This trap is generated when user started the process to upgrade power manager firmware. trapObjectUserName is name of the user who started FW upgrade. trapObjectAuxPortName is name of the IPDU port. trapObjectAuxPortNumber is aux port number of IPDU port. trapObjectPMNumber is PM socket number trapFirmwareVersion is current FW version of OnBoard. trapNewFirmwareVersion is NEW FW version of OnBoard.

trapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

trapObjectAuxPortName %parm[#2]%;

trapObjectAuxPortNumber %parm[#3]%;

trapObjectPMNumber %parm[#4]%;

trapFirmwareVersion %parm[#5]%;

trapNewFirmwareVersion %parm[#6]%;
event.logmsg: pmFirmwareUpgradeStarted trap received trapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]% trapObjectAuxPortName=%parm[#2]% trapObjectAuxPortNumber=%parm[#3]% trapObjectPMNumber=%parm[#4]% trapFirmwareVersion=%parm[#5]% trapNewFirmwareVersion=%parm[#6]%

event.descr:
This trap is generated when Power manager Firmware upgraded is done to indicate the result. trapObjectAuxPortName is name of the IPDU port. trapObjectAuxPortNumber is aux port number of IPDU port. trapObjectPMNumber is PM socket number trapFirmwareUpdateResult is result of FW upgrade 1 indicate successful other indicates error message. trapNewFirmwareVersion is NEW FW version of OnBoard.

trapObjectAuxPortName %parm[#1]%;

trapObjectAuxPortNumber %parm[#2]%;

trapObjectPMNumber %parm[#3]%;

trapFirmwareUpdateResult %parm[#4]%;

imageUpgradeSuccess(1) imageUpgradeInternalError(2)

trapNewFirmwareVersion %parm[#5]%;
event.logmsg: pmFirmwareUpgradeResultsTrap trap received trapObjectAuxPortName=%parm[#1]% trapObjectAuxPortNumber=%parm[#2]% trapObjectPMNumber=%parm[#3]% trapFirmwareUpdateResult=%parm[#4]% trapNewFirmwareVersion=%parm[#5]%

event.descr:
This trap is generated when a user's attempt to log into an device connected to the onboard fails. trapObjectUserName: contains the name of the user trapObjectDeviceNumber: contains the identifier of the device trapObjectDeviceName: contains the name of the device

trapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

trapObjectDeviceNumber %parm[#2]%;

trapObjectDeviceName %parm[#3]%;
event.logmsg: deviceAuth trap received trapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]% trapObjectDeviceNumber=%parm[#2]% trapObjectDeviceName=%parm[#3]%

event.descr:
This trap is generated when the user issues a command to the onboard and this command fails. trapObjectUserName: is the name of the user trapObjectCommand: is the name of the command the user is attempting trapObjectDeviceNumber: is the unique identifier of the device trapObjectDeviceName: is the name of the device

trapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

trapObjectCommand %parm[#2]%;

trapObjectDeviceNumber %parm[#3]%;

trapObjectDeviceName %parm[#4]%;
event.logmsg: deviceCommandFailureTrap trap received trapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]% trapObjectCommand=%parm[#2]% trapObjectDeviceNumber=%parm[#3]% trapObjectDeviceName=%parm[#4]%

event.descr:
This trap is sent when user connects to a device trapObjectUserName : The name of the user who started the session trapObjectDeviceNumber: is the unique identifier of the device trapObjectDeviceName: The name of the device

trapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

trapObjectDeviceNumber %parm[#2]%;

trapObjectDeviceName %parm[#3]%;
event.logmsg: deviceSPConsoleLoginTrap trap received trapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]% trapObjectDeviceNumber=%parm[#2]% trapObjectDeviceName=%parm[#3]%

event.descr:
This trap is sent when a session is stopped on specific device (User logs out). The name of the user who stopped the session is contain in trapObjectUserName. The Number of device is contained in trapObjectDeviceNumber. The name of the device is contained in trapObjectDeviceName.

trapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

trapObjectDeviceNumber %parm[#2]%;

trapObjectDeviceName %parm[#3]%;
event.logmsg: deviceSPConsoleLogoutTrap trap received trapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]% trapObjectDeviceNumber=%parm[#2]% trapObjectDeviceName=%parm[#3]%

event.descr:
This trap is sent when user connects directly to a device trapObjectUserName : The name of the user who started the session trapObjectDeviceNumber: is the unique identifier of the device trapObjectDeviceName: The name of the device

trapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

trapObjectDeviceNumber %parm[#2]%;

trapObjectDeviceName %parm[#3]%;
event.logmsg: deviceConsoleLoginTrap trap received trapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]% trapObjectDeviceNumber=%parm[#2]% trapObjectDeviceName=%parm[#3]%

event.descr:
This trap is sent when a user logs out of a direct login to the device. The name of the user who stopped the session is contain in trapObjectUserName. The Number of device is contained in trapObjectDeviceNumber. The name of the device is contained in trapObjectDeviceName.

trapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

trapObjectDeviceNumber %parm[#2]%;

trapObjectDeviceName %parm[#3]%;
event.logmsg: deviceDirectLogoutTrap trap received trapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]% trapObjectDeviceNumber=%parm[#2]% trapObjectDeviceName=%parm[#3]%

event.descr:
This trap is sent when a user enables NativeIP. trapObjectUserName: contains the name of the user trapObjectDeviceNumber: is the unique identifier of the device trapObjectDeviceName: contains the name of the device accessed

trapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

trapObjectDeviceNumber %parm[#2]%;

trapObjectDeviceName %parm[#3]%;
event.logmsg: nativeIPEnabledTrap trap received trapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]% trapObjectDeviceNumber=%parm[#2]% trapObjectDeviceName=%parm[#3]%

event.descr:
This trap is sent when a user disables NativeIP. trapObjectUserName: contains the name of the user trapObjectDeviceNumber: contains the device's Number trapObjectDeviceName: contains the name of the device accessed

trapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

trapObjectDeviceNumber %parm[#2]%;

trapObjectDeviceName %parm[#3]%;
event.logmsg: nativeIPDisabledTrap trap received trapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]% trapObjectDeviceNumber=%parm[#2]% trapObjectDeviceName=%parm[#3]%

event.descr:
This trap is sent when a user opens a connection through an SSH Tunnel. trapObjectUserName: contains the name of the user trapObjectDeviceNumber: contains the device's Number trapObjectDeviceName: contains the name of the device accessed

trapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

trapObjectDeviceNumber %parm[#2]%;

trapObjectDeviceName %parm[#3]%;
event.logmsg: sshTunnelInUseTrap trap received trapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]% trapObjectDeviceNumber=%parm[#2]% trapObjectDeviceName=%parm[#3]%

event.descr:
This trap is sent when a user closes a connection through an SSH Tunnel. trapObjectUserName: contains the name of the user trapObjectDeviceNumber: contains the device's Number trapObjectDeviceName: contains the name of the device accessed

trapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

trapObjectDeviceNumber %parm[#2]%;

trapObjectDeviceName %parm[#3]%;
event.logmsg: sshTunnelNotInUseTrap trap received trapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]% trapObjectDeviceNumber=%parm[#2]% trapObjectDeviceName=%parm[#3]%

event.descr:
This trap is sent when a user enables a Direct Command connection. trapObjectUserName: contains the name of the user trapObjectDeviceNumber: contains the device's Number trapObjectDeviceName: contains the name of the device accessed

trapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

trapObjectDeviceNumber %parm[#2]%;

trapObjectDeviceName %parm[#3]%;
event.logmsg: deviceDirectCommandEnableTrap trap received trapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]% trapObjectDeviceNumber=%parm[#2]% trapObjectDeviceName=%parm[#3]%

event.descr:
This trap is sent when a user disables a Direct Command connection. trapObjectUserName: contains the name of the user trapObjectDeviceNumber: contains the device's Number trapObjectDeviceName: contains the name of the device accessed

trapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

trapObjectDeviceNumber %parm[#2]%;

trapObjectDeviceName %parm[#3]%;
event.logmsg: deviceDirectCommandDisableTrap trap received trapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]% trapObjectDeviceNumber=%parm[#2]% trapObjectDeviceName=%parm[#3]%

event.descr:
This trap is sent when a user sends a reset command to a device. trapObjectUserName: contains the name of the user trapObjectDeviceNumber: contains the Number address of the device. trapObjectDeviceName: contains the name of the device

trapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

trapObjectDeviceNumber %parm[#2]%;

trapObjectDeviceName %parm[#3]%;
event.logmsg: deviceResetTrap trap received trapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]% trapObjectDeviceNumber=%parm[#2]% trapObjectDeviceName=%parm[#3]%

event.descr:
This trap is sent when a user sends a power up command to a device. trapObjectUserName: contains the name of the user trapObjectDeviceNumber: contains the Number address of the device. trapObjectDeviceName: contains the name of the device

trapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

trapObjectDeviceNumber %parm[#2]%;

trapObjectDeviceName %parm[#3]%;
event.logmsg: devicePowerUpTrap trap received trapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]% trapObjectDeviceNumber=%parm[#2]% trapObjectDeviceName=%parm[#3]%

event.descr:
This trap is sent when a user sends a power down command to a device. trapObjectUserName: contains the name of the user trapObjectDeviceNumber: contains the Number address of the device. trapObjectDeviceName: contains the name of the device

trapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

trapObjectDeviceNumber %parm[#2]%;

trapObjectDeviceName %parm[#3]%;
event.logmsg: devicePowerDownTrap trap received trapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]% trapObjectDeviceNumber=%parm[#2]% trapObjectDeviceName=%parm[#3]%

event.descr:
This trap is sent when a user sends a power cycle command to a device. trapObjectUserName: contains the name of the user trapObjectDeviceNumber: contains the Number address of the device. trapObjectDeviceName: contains the name of the device

trapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

trapObjectDeviceNumber %parm[#2]%;

trapObjectDeviceName %parm[#3]%;
event.logmsg: devicePowerCycleTrap trap received trapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]% trapObjectDeviceNumber=%parm[#2]% trapObjectDeviceName=%parm[#3]%

event.descr:
This trap is sent when a device managed by Onboard has had its data buffer cleared. trapObjectUserName: contains the user name trapObjectDeviceNumber: contains the Number address of the device trapObjectDeviceName: contains the name of the device

trapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

trapObjectDeviceNumber %parm[#2]%;

trapObjectDeviceName %parm[#3]%;
event.logmsg: deviceEventLogClearedTrap trap received trapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]% trapObjectDeviceNumber=%parm[#2]% trapObjectDeviceName=%parm[#3]%

event.descr:
This trap is sent when the datalog on a device managed by Onboard is full. trapObjectDeviceName: contains the name of the device trapObjectDeviceNumber: contains the Number address of the device trapObjectDataBufferSize: contains the size of the devices data log.

trapObjectDeviceName %parm[#1]%;

trapObjectDeviceNumber %parm[#2]%;

trapObjectDataBufferSize %parm[#3]%;
event.logmsg: deviceEventLogFullLostTrap trap received trapObjectDeviceName=%parm[#1]% trapObjectDeviceNumber=%parm[#2]% trapObjectDataBufferSize=%parm[#3]%

event.descr:
TBD This trap is sent when a user configured alarm string matches the data buffering line. trapObjectDeviceName is device name this matched occurred on. trapObjectDeviceNumber is device Number this matched occurred on trapObjectAlertMessage is entire LINE that contains the alert string. trapObjectAlertString is string that matched and contain in trapObjectPortAlertMessage.

trapObjectDeviceName %parm[#1]%;

trapObjectDeviceNumber %parm[#2]%;

trapObjectAlertMessage %parm[#3]%;

trapObjectAlertString %parm[#4]%;
event.logmsg: deviceAlertTrap trap received trapObjectDeviceName=%parm[#1]% trapObjectDeviceNumber=%parm[#2]% trapObjectAlertMessage=%parm[#3]% trapObjectAlertString=%parm[#4]%

event.descr:
This trap is sent when a user configured alarm string matches the data buffering line. trapObjectDeviceName: is device name this matched occurred on. trapObjectDeviceNumber: is device Number this matched occurred on trapObjectDeviceSensorName: is the name of the sensor trapObjectDeviceSensorAlarmId: is the id of the sensor alarm

trapObjectDeviceName %parm[#1]%;

trapObjectDeviceNumber %parm[#2]%;

trapObjectDeviceSensorName %parm[#3]%;

trapObjectDeviceSensorAlarmId %parm[#4]%;
event.logmsg: deviceSensorAlarmTrap trap received trapObjectDeviceName=%parm[#1]% trapObjectDeviceNumber=%parm[#2]% trapObjectDeviceSensorName=%parm[#3]% trapObjectDeviceSensorAlarmId=%parm[#4]%
